comments.body: [this line in the source](https://github.com/JedWatson/react-select/blob/master/lib/Select.js#L848) suggests that the author prefers the default export and the `module.exports =` line is just there for backwards compatibility. probably makes sense to leave this as an `export default`?
i wasn't able to use that default export in our webpack setup, which is why i ended up doing this whole thing. i suppose i'll have to take a deeper look.

the packaged `react-select.js` file that i installed from bower exposes a single global `Select` which is the JSX constructor itself. There's no `default` export available, so I had to refactor typings to use the namespace syntax for them to compile. Perhaps if we were installing from npm and bundling react-select in webpack then this would be different.

Which is a pretty bad situation for typings, if the usage is wildly different based on your build system...

Yeah, the UMD typings support is not good right now, but they're [working on it](https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/issues/7125) (wow, just realized it merged!). For now though I guess using the `export =` syntax makes sense; it has the greatest flexibility / interoperability.
For the below, refer to https://github.com/JedWatson/react-select/blob/master/src/Select.js#L29 and its contents
See https://github.com/JedWatson/react-select/#effeciently-rendering-large-lists-with-windowing for a list of `menuRenderer` props
